query: I'm moving from leeds to Southampton. Will I need a new care needs assessment or can my current care package transfer?

retrieved_documents.content: Changes to your care Find out what to do if your social care needs change, you cannot afford care anymore, or you're moving to another address. Change of address If you move, you need to let us know . Then we can make sure there is no gap in your care and support. Leaving Leeds If you move to an area which falls under another council, we will work with your new council to make sure there's no break in your care. Before you move, your new council will assess your needs and agree a new support plan with you. If this is not possible the new council will arrange the care and support we outlined in your previous plan. Changes in your needs or finances If your needs or finances change, get in touch with your social worker and let them know. If you do not have a social worker or you do not know their contact details, you can contact us instead. We'll arrange for your social worker or another member of their team to call you back

care See how to make changes to someone's care or tell us about a change in their address or situation Looking after a friend or relative We can support you to care for a friend or family member by finding ways to make life easier, including taking a break Speaking for someone who needs care How to be involved in decisions about someone's care and finances, whether they have mental capacity or not Care Delivery Service Our Care Delivery Service is a group of Leeds City Council services providing care and support for adults Give feedback and let us know if this page was helpful

Needs assessments Find out what to expect when you have a needs assessment, including where it happens and what you'll talk about. What it is and how to get one When you contact us for help, we may arrange for you to speak with a social worker, wellbeing worker or occupational therapist. They’ll have a conversation with you to find out what kind of support will help you best. This is called a needs assessment. Get a needs assessment You can call us to talk about getting your need assessed. Find out how to contact us on how to get help . Where you’ll be assessed The assessment can be in your own home or we may offer you an appointment at a talking point. Talking points are sessions held all over Leeds in places like community hubs and One Stop Centres. If you can travel, it’s often easier to get a talking point appointment than it is to get a home appointment. Bringing someone with you You can have someone with you for support during your assessment. This could be a carer, friend or family member

. If something changes and you no longer qualify for NHS Continuing Health Care Funding, you will need to start paying for your care, and you will need a financial assessment review. Contact us Phone 0113 378 8559 Monday to Friday, 9am to 4:30pm Email contacts.ccf@leeds.gov.uk Post Adults Operational Services Community Care Finance 5th Floor East Leeds City Council Merrion House 110 Merrion Centre Leeds LS2 8BB Part of Help paying for care homes Show summaries Help paying for care homes Find out how to get help to pay for your residential care. Getting a financial assessment You will need a financial assessment to see if you can get help to pay your care fees. Find out how to get one and what to expect. How we look at your money How we look at your finances and decide if you get help to pay your care home fees Examples: how much people pay for care homes See how much people pay for their care homes and how we work out the amount of financial help they get

. It helps you to plan and prepare for CQC inspection, respond to internal audits and deliver good and outstanding care. Leeds City Council financial queries team The financial queries team can help with queries relating to Leeds City Council payments to care homes.  Please note that the financial queries team do not liaise directly with members of the public Email: Remittanceadvice@Leeds.gov.uk New procedure for Payments to Care Homes from admittance Leeds City Council has been developing its payment system to enable payments to care homes to be made as soon as a care plan is approved, currently payment awaits the completion of a financial assessment. This will go live for all new care packages approved on or after 1 st June 2020 What will the system do initially? For all NEW clients, as soon as the care plan is approved in the system, it will generate a payment (weekly rate less minimum client contribution) to be paid on the next 4 weekly payment run– This will be known as a provisional payment

about getting a personal assistant to support you to live independently A helper to live with you If you have a spare room, Leeds Homeshare can find someone to share your home and help with household tasks like shopping and cleaning Help to pay for care and support services Get help paying for support at home, read about financial assessments, personal budgets and direct payments The community wellbeing hub Support for the over 50s in Black, Asian, minority ethnic  communities in Leeds Care Delivery Service Our Care Delivery Service is a group of Leeds City Council services providing care and support for adults Give feedback and let us know if this page was helpful

to help you stay safe and live well at home Care Delivery Service Our Care Delivery Service is a group of Leeds City Council services providing care and support for adults Care homes and supported housing Care homes, extra care housing, retirement life communities and mental health housing support Looking after a friend or relative Get support while caring for someone, including help to take a break and carer's assessments Changes to your care or situation Tell us about a change in your care needs, finances or address if you already get care through the council Mental health services Mental health problems are common and can be treated

. This may change your benefits. You should contact the DWP (Department for Work and Pensions) to find out what you qualify for. Find out more about care homes and benefits at Turn2Us.org.uk . Contact us Phone 0113 378 8559 Monday to Friday, 9am to 4:30pm Email contacts.ccf@leeds.gov.uk Post Adults Operational Services Community Care Finance 5th Floor East Leeds City Council Merrion House 110 Merrion Centre Leeds LS2 8BB Part of Help paying for care homes Show summaries Help paying for care homes Find out how to get help to pay for your residential care. Getting a financial assessment You will need a financial assessment to see if you can get help to pay your care fees. Find out how to get one and what to expect. How we look at your money How we look at your finances and decide if you get help to pay your care home fees Examples: how much people pay for care homes See how much people pay for their care homes and how we work out the amount of financial help they get

. Find out more about getting help to pay for care . Services you will need to pay for There are some things that you will probably have to pay for yourself. Respite care (weekly breaks in a care home) Age of person Typical cost Under 25 £140.20 per week Between 25 and state pension age £159.40 per week State pension age and over £196.45 per week Respite care can also be for less than a week – for a few days or an overnight stay. Read more about how we can help you take a break from caring on: looking after a family member or friend . Meal charges Meals provided at a Leeds City Council-owned day centre: Meal Typical cost Main meal including dessert £7.40 per meal Second meal (teatime) £4.20 per meal Personal safety alarm (telecare) The alarm itself is free, but there is a weekly cost to have it monitored. Find full details on our page about help and safety alarms in the home . How to get help To talk to us about your needs and plan your support, find out how to get help

. Find out more about arranging your care with direct payments . Direct payment support We can support, advise and provide information about employing a PA, however you fund your support. Leeds Direct Payment and PA Support Hub offer the following services: help with PA recruitment (including our PA register) support planning service support for employers access to training for PA's and Employers To use our service, you can complete the online referral form , or contact us by: Email: LeedsDPandPAsupporthub@leeds.gov.uk Phone: 0113 378 3936 Social workers or professionals involved in your support can also make a referral for you. You will need to sign a service agreement and agree to the terms and conditions of the service before the service starts. These documents will be sent to you once a referral has been accepted. If you are supported by Leeds Social Care (Adults or Children's) or the NHS, then our services are paid for by them. If you fund your own care, you can also use the service as a self-funder

answer:
If you are moving from Leeds to Southampton, you will need a new care needs assessment by the Southampton council. **Your current care package from Leeds will not automatically transfer.** However, Leeds City Council will work with the new council to ensure there's no break in your care.

- **Before moving**, inform Leeds City Council about your change of address. They will coordinate with Southampton to facilitate a smooth transition.
- **Southampton Council** will conduct a new assessment of your needs and agree on a support plan with you. If they are unable to do this immediately, they will arrange care based on your existing Leeds plan until the new assessment is completed.

For further assistance, contact Leeds City Council's Adult Social Care at 0113 378 8559 or email contacts.ccf@leeds.gov.uk. More information can be found on their website: [Leeds Adult Social Care](https://www.leeds.gov.uk/adult-social-care/changes-to-your-care).

test_metadata.prompt_template:
Please answer the following question about social care services in UK local authorities based only on the information in the provided documents.

Question: {query}

Context from relevant documents:
{context}

Instructions:
1. Provide a clear, direct answer that would help someone needing this information. If information isn't available, state: "The available documents don't provide specific information about [aspect]."

2. Synthesize information from ALL relevant documents to provide the most complete answer rather than analyzing documents individually.

3. Structure your response with:
   - A concise 1-2 sentence summary first
   - Relevant details organized in short, clear paragraphs
   - Bullet points for lists or step-by-step information
   - Bold text for key information the user should notice

4. For financial information:
   - Include exact figures, time periods, and what the funding covers
   - Present financial data clearly: "The adult social care budget is **£X million** for [time period]"

5. Always include practical next steps or resources:
   - Provide contact information, URLs, or application methods mentioned in the documents
   - Suggest where the person could find more information

6. When citing sources, use a simple format: "According to [document name/description]" or include URLs where available.

Answer:
